artefact.overview: You need a licence to reproduce the words of hymns or worship songs for collective worship at schools
artefact.licence_short_description: Collective worship reproduction licence for schools from Christian Copyright Licensing International .
artefact.licence_overview:
If you reproduce the words of hymns or worship songs for use during assemblies or other collective worship events at your school, you need a licence from [Christian Copyright Licensing International (CCLI).](http://www.ccli.co.uk/ "Christian Copyright Licensing International"){:rel="external"}

You need a licence if you:

* create your own service sheets or hymn books for pupils and staff
* create your own overhead projector acetates
* create your own song words database for use with song projection software
* type song words into your computer and store them for future use
* record music from your services (eg carol services) on video or audio

If you want to photocopy directly from music publications, you must also have a collective worship music reproduction licence.

##How to apply

You can apply for a collective worship copyright licence online on the [CCLI website.](http://www.ccli.co.uk/licences/ "Apply for a licence"){:rel="external"}

You must pay a licence fee based on the number of pupils at your school.

Licences must be renewed annually.

##Conditions

Licences are subject to certain conditions, such as:

* ensuring that all reproduced songs contain the full and correct song title, writer credit(s) and copyright notice
* supplying CCLI with a copy of any reproduced song on request
* using CCLI's CopyReport software to report all the songs that have been reproduced under your licence

##Fines and penalties

%If you reproduce the words of hymns or worship songs without a licence, you are infringing copyright and could be sued for damages.%

If you fail to pay the licence fee or comply with any other licence conditions, CCLI may terminate the licence. If that happens, you must stop using any reproduced songs and arrange for them to be destroyed.

*[CCLI]: Christian Copyright Licensing International
